Title: Let's Make Curry!
subtitle: Animation
Prompt/problem: For our final project, our professor gave us just one requirement: have fun and exercise new skills you learned during the semester and experiment with new ones. My roommates and I love to make curry, so I thought that I would create an abstract representation of our go to recipe.

Title: Paris Tourism App
subtitle: Interactive map of Paris built with the Google Maps API
Goals:
• User loads the page and sees a large, navigable map with multiple points highlights/pined.
  • User clicks on a pin and sees an info window with some information.
  • User wants more information so the click for more info and a modal or overlay window appears with the full details.
  • User closes the modal/overlay and can navigate with the map again.
  • User toggles to listed view and clicks a list item to see the modal/overlay window.
Prompt/problem: Create a unique, full-screen map experience and scroll experience that works on mobile and desktop. The map should display at least 12 locations and include photos, videos, text, and links to a modal/overlay detail page for each item.

Title: Coulture Magazine
subtitle: Co-Design Editor
contributions:
• Release a fall and spring issue each year
  • Lead a group of 12 graphic design students in creating spreads that are cohesive and well-designed
  • Contribute to the overall production of editing the magazine alongside the editors-in-chief

Title: My Fridge
subtitle: App Concept
Overview: An app that makes picking what to cook easier, cheaper, and more eco-aware
Goals:
• Teaching users how to cook healthier meals for themselves and others
  • Making cooking & meal planning  more enjoyable experiences through convenience and ease
  • Helping users save money on groceries
  • Reducing food waste by helping users prioritize food before it goes bad
contributions: Starting with the formation of a "how can we" question I began my design process. I decided on the scope of my users, completed competitive analysis, and created personas. From there, I compiled the style guide of my product and begun wiring framing. With the conduction of user testing and feedback reviews, I iterated on my design till it thoroughly solved my design question: how can we make home cooking easier, healthier, and more interesting?
Prompt/problem: What should I make for dinner tonight? This is a question most people have asked themselves at least once in their lifetime. Cooking for yourself or your family can be hard, and if not done the right way can result in unhealthy meals, wasted food and money. MyFridge aims to make cooking more convenient and enjoyable for all.

Title: WRAL Redesign
subtitle: Redesign Proposal
Overview: Our class partnered with WRAL.com to pitch redesign concepts for their website.
Purpose: My UI/UX design and research class partnered with WRAL.com to evaluate the current structure of their site and propose improvements. This project took place over 2 months and included 3 separated projects which all worked off of each other. At the end of this project, we presented our findings to members of the WRAL website team. The findings of these are collected in this case study. To find read my usability report on the WRAL weather app, click here.
contributions: What makes WRAL unique is its relevance to local news/information. With my site redesign I wanted to draw attention to the "local" aspects of the site. I streamlined all the different local aspects into its own category instead of having local aspects be spread out throughout the site. With the redesign users should be able to quickly find local news, as well as events and safety information about where they live. Additionally, I wanted to bring more organization to the site by creating less overlap between sections.
Prompt/problem: How might we increase the usability of WRAL.com to make it more beneficial to members of the community looking for news and local information.

Title: Lux: Media Hub
subtitle: Case Competition
Overview: A case competition completed during the second to last week of my 10 week summer internship with Red Ventures. Each digital designer was paired with a copy writer to create a brand strategy and landing page for a new entertainment platform. Our team ended up placing second.
Goals:
A comprehensive media experience for customers looking to bundle media subscriptions.
Five core offerings: video, music, app games, eBooks, & online fitness
contributions:
- Visual brand identity and sub-branding

- High-fi mockup of the homepage experience

- Marketing strategy
tag_line: Lux is your guide through an adventure that�s more than just media.
Prompt/problem: After the successful acquisition of RedTV+, Red Ventures has decided to create a broader media company dedicated to offering customers with bundled media subscription options. You and your team have been tasked with conceptualizing and producing branding and marketing materials as a proof of concept for this new business.

Title: Where are all the girls?
subtitle: Interactive Dashboard
Overview: What are the roadblocks women in STEM face and how can they be decreased.
Goals:
• Incorporate interactive elements to display data
  • Use Google dev chars
  • Responsive Design
contributions:
I used an interactive timeline to display all the roadblocks that girls face when getting into the tech industry. In addition to this I "wrote" a code that ran a solution function to get rid of the road blocks.


‍
Prompt/problem: Create an interactive dashboard that uses javascript to show data in a non-traditional way.

Title: Infrographics
subtitle: Collection of Infographics
contributions: Works created during my infographics class at UNC-Chapel Hill. This class functions as the advanced graphic design course in the Media and Journalism School. We were encouraged to find ways to tell stories through design

Title: To Her Credit
Project Details: During my summer 2020 internship with Red Ventures, the design interns were assigned a design sprint to design a fake female finance editorial site. We were given three work days to design branding, establish brand voice & mission statement, and create a responsive landing page.
subtitle: Design Sprint Challenge
Overview: Design proposal for a female-focused finance blog
contributions:
• Design the branding (logo, colors, font)
  • Come up with the brand pyramid, values, mission statement, our promise of site
  • Design the desktop and mobile landing page experience
  • Present to a panel of stakeholders
tag_line: Changing the financial narrative for her
Prompt/problem: The pain point I interpreted for this site was the lack of female-centered financial advice on mainstream platforms.
